revised_title: The Fine Structure of Phloem Fibers: Untreated and Swollen Hemp
tldr: The authors investigate the fine structure of phloem fibers in hemp plants using untreated and swollen samples. They find that swelling techniques can produce distorted results and should not be used to study the intact plant cell wall. The study focuses on the hemp fiber, which occurs only in phloem tissue and is either primary or secondary depending on its development from procambium or cambium.
